when_to_say: When greeting someone informally
example: Hola, ¿cómo estás? (OH-lah, KOH-moh ehs-TAHS?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: When parting from someone
example: Adiós, nos vemos mañana. (ah-dee-OHS, nohs VEH-mohs mah-NYAH-nah) - Goodbye, see you tomorrow.

when_to_say: When expressing gratitude
example: Gracias por tu ayuda. (GRAH-syahs pohr too ah-YOO-dah) - Thank you for your help.

when_to_say: When apologizing or asking for forgiveness
example: Perdón, no te escuché. (pehr-DOHN, noh teh ehs-koo-CHAY) - Sorry, I didn't hear you.

when_to_say: When referring to water as a drink or resource
example: Quiero agua, por favor. (kee-EH-roh AH-gwah, pohr fah-VOHR) - I want water, please.

when_to_say: When referring to the action of running
example: Me gusta correr por las mañanas. (meh GOO-stah koh-REHR pohr lahs mah-NYAH-nahs) - I like to run in the mornings.

when_to_say: When describing speed or quickness
example: El coche es muy rápido. (ehl KOH-cheh ehs mwee RAH-pee-doh) - The car is very fast.

when_to_say: When describing a positive emotional state
example: Estoy feliz por verte. (ehs-TOY feh-LEES pohr VEHR-teh) - I'm happy to see you.

when_to_say: When describing the color yellow
example: El sol es amarillo. (ehl sohl ehs ah-mah-REE-yoh) - The sun is yellow.

when_to_say: When talking about relatives or household
example: Mi familia es muy grande. (mee fah-MEE-lee-ah ehs mwee GRAHN-deh) - My family is very big.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of paying attention to sounds
example: Me gusta escuchar música. (meh GOO-stah ehs-koo-CHAR MOO-see-kah) - I like to listen to music.

when_to_say: When referring to books or reading materials
example: Estoy leyendo un libro interesante. (ehs-TOY leh-YEN-doh oon LEE-broh een-tehr-eh-SAHN-teh) - I am reading an interesting book.

when_to_say: When describing size or magnitude
example: La casa es muy grande. (lah KAH-sah ehs mwee GRAHN-deh) - The house is very big.

when_to_say: When describing something of a small size
example: El perro es pequeño. (ehl PEH-rroh ehs peh-KEHN-yoh) - The dog is small.

when_to_say: When referring to the action of walking
example: Me gusta caminar por el parque. (meh GOO-stah kah-mee-NAHR pohr ehl PAHR-keh) - I like to walk in the park.

when_to_say: When talking about a male friend
example: Mi amigo es muy divertido. (mee ah-MEE-goh ehs mwee dee-ver-TEE-doh) - My friend is very fun.

when_to_say: When referring to eating food
example: Me gusta comer pizza. (meh GOO-stah koh-MEHR PEE-tsah) - I like to eat pizza.

when_to_say: When referring to an educational institution
example: Voy a la escuela todos los días. (voy ah lah ehs-KWEH-lah TOH-dohs lohs dee-AHS) - I go to school every day.

when_to_say: When referring to doing a job or task
example: Tengo que trabajar hasta tarde. (TEHN-goh keh trah-bah-HAHR AHS-tah TAR-deh) - I have to work late.

when_to_say: When referring to relatives or a household
example: Mi familia vive en España. (mee fah-MEE-lee-ah VEE-veh ehn ehs-PAH-nyah) - My family lives in Spain.

when_to_say: When referring to a city or urban area
example: Madrid es una ciudad hermosa. (mah-DREED ehs OO-nah syoo-DAHD ehr-MOH-sah) - Madrid is a beautiful city.

when_to_say: When describing strength or power
example: El viento es muy fuerte hoy. (ehl VYEHN-toh ehs mwee FWEHR-teh oy) - The wind is very strong today.

when_to_say: When describing something of small size, feminine
example: La habitación es pequeña. (lah ah-bee-tah-SYOHN ehs peh-KEHN-yah) - The room is small.

when_to_say: When describing the color blue
example: El cielo está azul. (ehl SYEH-loh ehs-TAH ah-SOOL) - The sky is blue.

when_to_say: When referring to the action of dancing
example: Me encanta bailar salsa. (meh ehn-KAHN-tah by-LAHR SAHL-sah) - I love to dance salsa.

when_to_say: When referring to time or weather
example: No tengo tiempo ahora. (noh TEHN-goh tyem-POH ah-OH-rah) - I don't have time now.

when_to_say: When describing temperature or sensation
example: El café está caliente. (ehl kah-FEH ehs-TAH kah-lyehn-teh) - The coffee is hot.

when_to_say: When describing someone as friendly or kind
example: Ella es muy amable. (EHL-yah ehs MWEY ah-MAH-bleh) - She is very kind.

when_to_say: When referring to writing
example: Me gusta escribir cuentos. (meh goo-STAH ehs-kree-BEER KWEHN-tohs) - I like to write stories.

when_to_say: When describing the color green
example: El césped está verde. (ehl SEHS-pehd ehs-TAH BEHR-deh) - The grass is green.

when_to_say: When expressing joy or happiness
example: Estoy muy feliz hoy. (es-TOY mwee feh-LEES oy) - I am very happy today.

when_to_say: When referring to reading books, articles, etc.
example: Me gusta leer novelas. (meh GOOS-tah leh-EHR noh-VEH-lahs) - I like to read novels.

when_to_say: When describing something as recently acquired or created
example: Tengo un carro nuevo. (TEHN-goh oon KAHR-roh NWAE-voh) - I have a new car.

example: La casa es grande. (lah KAH-sah ehs GRAHN-deh) - The house is big.

when_to_say: When describing speed or quickness
example: El coche es muy rápido. (ehl KOH-cheh ehs mwee RAH-pee-doh) - The car is very fast.

when_to_say: When describing beauty

when_to_say: When referring to hearing attentively
example: Me gusta escuchar música. (meh GOOS-tah es-koo-CHAR MOO-see-kah) - I like to listen to music.

when_to_say: When referring to the afternoon time

when_to_say: When describing significance or priority
example: Es importante estudiar. (es eem-por-TAHN-teh es-too-DYAR) - It is important to study.

when_to_say: When referring to a domestic feline
example: El gato duerme todo el día. (ehl GAH-toh DWER-meh TOH-doh ehl DYAH) - The cat sleeps all day.

when_to_say: When referring to a glass opening in a wall
example: Abre la ventana, por favor. (AH-breh lah ven-TAH-nah por fah-VOHR) - Open the window, please.

when_to_say: When referring to exiting or going out
example: Voy a salir con mis amigos. (voy ah sah-LEER kohn mees ah-MEE-gohs) - I’m going out with my friends.

when_to_say: When describing the state of being happy
example: La felicidad es importante. (lah feh-lee-see-DAHD ehs eem-por-TAHN-teh) - Happiness is important.

when_to_say: When referring to walking on foot
example: Vamos a caminar por el parque. (VAH-mos ah kah-mee-NAR por ehl PAR-keh) - Let's walk through the park.

when_to_say: When referring to playing games or sports
example: Quiero jugar fútbol. (kyeh-ROH hoo-GAR FOOT-bohl) - I want to play soccer.

example: Mi familia es muy grande. (mee fah-MEE-lyah ehs mwee GRAHN-deh) - My family is very large.

example: Necesito más dinero. (neh-seh-SEE-toh mahs dee-NEH-roh) - I need more money.

example: Mi amigo es muy amable. (mee ah-MEE-goh ehs mwee ah-MAH-bleh) - My friend is very kind.

when_to_say: When referring to the state of being happy
example: La felicidad es importante. (lah feh-lee-see-DAHD ehs eem-pohr-TAHN-teh) - Happiness is important.

example: Me gusta viajar a otros países. (meh GOOS-tah vee-ah-HAHR ah OH-trohs PAH-ee-sehs) - I like to travel to other countries.

example: El café está caliente. (ehl kah-FEH ehs-TAH kah-lee-EHN-teh) - The coffee is hot.

example: Hace frío hoy. (AH-seh FREE-oh oy) - It’s cold today.

example: La libertad es esencial. (lah lee-behr-TAHD ehs ehs-sehn-SYAHL) - Freedom is essential.

example: La amistad verdadera es invaluable. (lah ah-mees-TAHD beh-reh-DAH-reh ehs een-vah-loo-AH-bleh) - True friendship is invaluable.

when_to_say: When referring to a place with books or for studying
example: Voy a la biblioteca a estudiar. (voy ah lah bee-blee-oh-TEH-kah ah ehs-too-dee-AHR) - I’m going to the library to study.

when_to_say: When referring to a written composition
example: Tengo que escribir un ensayo para la clase. (TEHN-goh keh ehs-kree-BEER oon ehn-SAH-yoh pah-rah lah KLAH-seh) - I have to write an essay for class.

when_to_say: When describing something unique or strange
example: Su estilo de vestir es muy peculiar. (soo ehs-TEE-loh deh ves-TEER ehs mwee peh-coo-lee-AHR) - Their dressing style is very peculiar.

when_to_say: When describing someone rigid or unwilling to change
example: Ella es intransigente en sus opiniones. (EH-yah ehs een-trahn-see-HEN-teh ehn soos oh-pee-nee-OH-nehs) - She is uncompromising in her opinions.

when_to_say: When describing something short-lived
example: El placer efímero no trae felicidad. (ehl plah-SEHR eh-FEE-meh-roh noh trah-eh feh-lee-see-DAHD) - Ephemeral pleasure doesn’t bring happiness.

when_to_say: When expressing a deep desire or longing
example: Tengo un anhelo de viajar. (TEHN-goh oon ahn-HEH-loh deh bee-ah-HAHR) - I have a yearning to travel.

when_to_say: When discussing strong resolve or will
example: Ella mostró gran determinación para ganar. (EH-yah mohs-TROH grahn deh-tehr-mee-nah-see-ON pah-rah gah-NAHR) - She showed great determination to win.

when_to_say: When describing skillful and articulate speech
example: Su elocuencia cautivó a la audiencia. (soo eh-loh-KWEN-see-ah cow-tee-VOH ah lah ow-DYEHN-see-ah) - His eloquence captivated the audience.

when_to_say: When talking about bravery or boldness
example: Tuvo el coraje de decir la verdad. (TOO-voh ehl koh-RAH-heh deh deh-SEER lah behr-DAHD) - He had the courage to tell the truth.

when_to_say: When referring to self-sacrifice or altruism
example: Su abnegación es digna de admiración. (soo ahb-neh-gah-SEE-ON ehs DEEG-nah deh ahd-mee-rah-see-ON) - Her selflessness is admirable.

when_to_say: When referring to confronting or opposing something
example: Quiero desafiar mis límites. (kee-EH-roh deh-sah-FYAR mees LEE-mee-tehs) - I want to challenge my limits.

when_to_say: When talking about persistence in achieving a goal
example: La perseverancia es clave para el éxito. (lah pehr-seh-behr-AHN-see-ah ehs KLAH-beh pah-rah ehl EHK-see-toh) - Perseverance is key to success.

when_to_say: When describing something that cannot be erased or forgotten
example: Dejó una impresión indeleble en su vida. (deh-HOH oo-nah eem-preh-SEE-ON een-deh-LEH-bleh ehn soo VEE-dah) - He left an indelible impression on her life.

when_to_say: When asserting or claiming something back
example: El pueblo luchó por reivindicar sus derechos. (ehl PWEH-blo loo-CHOH pohr ray-veen-dee-KAHR soos deh-REH-chos) - The people fought to reclaim their rights.

when_to_say: When referring to something unchanging over time
example: La verdad es inmutable. (lah behr-DAHD ehs een-moo-TAH-bleh) - The truth is immutable.

when_to_say: When referring to sharp mental ability
example: La sagacidad del líder fue evidente. (lah sah-gah-see-DAHD del LEE-dehr fweh eh-bee-DEN-teh) - The leader’s shrewdness was evident.

when_to_say: When talking about the source or origin of something
example: El ruido proveniente de la calle es molesto. (ehl ROO-ee-doh proh-veh-NYEHN-teh deh lah KAH-yeh ehs moh-LES-toh) - The noise originating from the street is annoying.

when_to_say: When discussing a lack of certainty
example: La incertidumbre afecta nuestras decisiones. (lah een-sehr-tee-DOOM-breh ah-FEHK-tah nooehs-TRAHS deh-see-SYOH-nehs) - Uncertainty affects our decisions.

when_to_say: When describing something too great to be expressed in words
example: La belleza del paisaje es inefable. (lah beh-YEH-sah del pahy-SAHE ehs een-eh-FAH-bleh) - The beauty of the landscape is ineffable.

when_to_say: When referring to a magician or performer of illusions
example: El prestidigitador dejó al público asombrado. (ehl prehs-tee-dee-hee-tah-DOR deh-HOH ahl POOB-lee-koh ah-sohm-BRAH-doh) - The illusionist left the audience amazed.

when_to_say: When referring to violating rules or norms
example: Decidió no transgredir las normas. (deh-see-DYOH noh trahns-greh-DEER lahs NOR-mahs) - He decided not to transgress the rules.

when_to_say: When describing something intense or overpowering
example: El trabajo fue abrumador hoy. (ehl trah-BAH-hoh fweh ah-broo-mah-DOR oy) - The workload was overwhelming today.

when_to_say: When referring to a state of fullness or abundance
example: Vive en plenitud cada día. (VEE-veh ehn pleh-nee-TOOD KAH-dah DEE-ah) - Live each day in plenitude.

when_to_say: When referring to bitterness in speech or behavior
example: Su acrimonia dañó la discusión. (soo ah-kree-MOH-nyah dah-NYOH lah dees-koo-SYOHN) - His acrimony damaged the discussion.

when_to_say: When describing opposing ideas or statements
example: Hay una contradicción en su testimonio. (ahy OO-nah kohn-trah-deek-SYOHN ehn soo tehs-tee-MOH-nyoh) - There is a contradiction in his testimony.

when_to_say: When referring to someone or something unconquerable
example: Su espíritu es indomable. (soo ehs-PEE-ree-too ehs een-doh-MAH-bleh) - His spirit is indomitable.

when_to_say: When describing something that leaves a strong emotional impact
example: La escena fue sobrecogedora. (lah es-SEH-nah fweh soh-breh-koh-heh-DOR-ah) - The scene was overwhelming.

when_to_say: When referring to a chain or series of events
example: La concatenación de eventos fue inesperada. (lah kohn-kah-teh-nah-SYOHN deh eh-VEHN-tohs fweh ee-neh-speh-RAH-dah) - The concatenation of events was unexpected.

when_to_say: When describing someone unwilling to compromise
example: Era intransigente en su postura. (EH-rah een-trahn-see-HEN-teh ehn soo pohs-TOO-rah) - He was intransigent in his stance.

when_to_say: When describing a catastrophic or end-of-the-world scenario
example: La película tenía un tono apocalíptico. (lah peh-LEE-koo-lah teh-NEE-ah oon TOH-noh ah-poh-kah-LEEP-tee-koh) - The movie had an apocalyptic tone.

when_to_say: When referring to exaggerated statements or claims
example: Su discurso estaba lleno de hipérboles. (soo dees-KOOR-soh ehs-TAH-bah YEH-noh deh ee-PEHR-boh-lehs) - His speech was full of hyperboles.

when_to_say: When describing something that reflects light and changes colors
example: Las plumas del pájaro eran iridiscentes. (lahs PLOO-mahs del PAH-hah-roh EH-rahn ee-ree-dees-SEN-tehs) - The bird's feathers were iridescent.

when_to_say: When discussing liberation from constraints
example: La emancipación fue un proceso largo. (lah eh-mahn-see-pah-SYOHN fweh oon proh-SEH-soh LAHR-goh) - The emancipation was a long process.

when_to_say: When referring to someone paying great attention to detail
example: Es meticuloso en su trabajo. (ehs meh-tee-koo-LOH-soh ehn soo trah-BAH-hoh) - He is meticulous in his work.
